title: Sonia Gandhi voter roll row: Delhi court dismisses plea seeking action
content: A Delhi court has dismissed a plea seeking action against Congress leader Sonia Gandhi over allegations regarding her inclusion in the electoral rolls before she became an Indian citizen. The complainant, Vikas Tripathi, argued that Gandhi's name was added to the New Delhi constituency's voter list in 1980, prior to her citizenship in 1983.

title: Gemini app tops 10M users: Nano Banana fuels buzz; viral prompts to try
content: Google's Gemini app, featuring the AI image editing tool Nano Banana, has achieved over 10 million downloads shortly after its launch. Users have already created or modified over 200 million images, leveraging Nano Banana's speed and accuracy. Viral trends showcase the tool's versatility, allowing users to transform themselves into action figures, appear in different decades, and step into famous artworks.

title: UK PM removes Mandelson as US ambassador over fresh Epstein revelations
content: UK Prime Minister ousted Peter Mandelson as Ambassador to the US after emails revealed a deeper relationship with Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence suggested Mandelson defended Epstein's initial conviction, a stance undisclosed during his appointment. The sacking followed reports by The Sun and Bloomberg detailing supportive messages sent to Epstein during a 2008 investigation.

title: 200 flyers left sweating on Singapore-bound Air India flight; stranded inside for 2hrs
content: Over 200 passengers on an Air India flight to Singapore faced a distressing ordeal at Delhi airport. Due to malfunctioning air conditioning and electrical systems on Wednesday night, passengers were stuck inside the Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner for nearly two hours. The discomfort led to passengers using newspapers as fans before being deplaned.

title: 'Never understand USA': Faf baffled after Kirk's assassination; 'can have a gun'
content: Political activist Charlie Kirk was fatally shot at Utah Valley University during his comeback tour, prompting a widespread search for the shooter. The incident has sparked reactions, including from Donald Trump, who lamented it as a "dark moment." Ex South Africa skipper Faf du Plessis voiced concerns about American gun laws.

title: ‘He was murdered’: Musk’s reply to Altman who called OpenAI researcher's death as suicide
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said Suchir Balaji's death was a suicide. He mentioned Balaji worked at OpenAI. Altman's statement followed the researcher's death in San Francisco last year. Balaji's parents had earlier dismissed suicide claims. Elon Musk reacted sharply to Altman's remarks. Musk alleged Balaji was murdered. The exchange occurred during an interview with Tucker Carlson.

title: 'Multiple active crime scenes': Who killed Charlie Kirk? Police widen search for sniper
content: Charlie Kirk was fatally shot while addressing a crowd at Utah Valley University, prompting an intense manhunt for the rooftop sniper. The conservative activist was answering questions about gun violence when the incident occurred, leading to a campus lockdown. Authorities are actively investigating multiple crime scenes and have questioned, then released, two individuals initially detained.

title: HDFC: Multiple services to be unavailable for several hours on September 13 - check details
content: HDFC Bank will conduct scheduled maintenance on September 13th, 2025, from 12:30 AM to 7:30 AM IST to enhance system performance. During this period, NetBanking, MobileBanking, UPI services, and some ATM/debit card functionalities will be unavailable. Customers are advised to use PayZapp Wallet for uninterrupted payments, while credit card services will remain largely operational.

title: Google Gemini Nano Banana – What it is, how it works, and what all you can do with it
content: Google has unveiled 'Nano Banana,' an AI image editing model integrated into the Gemini app. Developed by Google DeepMind, it's hailed as the top image editing system, allowing users to manipulate photos via simple text prompts. Nano Banana excels at maintaining consistent character likeness across edits, preserving facial features and characteristics.

title: Aishwarya Rai personality rights case: HC orders takedown of unauthorized content featuring actor
content: The Delhi High Court has granted Aishwarya Rai Bachchan interim relief in a case concerning the unauthorized use of her name, image, and persona on digital platforms, including AI-generated content. The court directed platforms, e-commerce sites, and Google to remove infringing content and block specified URLs within 72 hours. Read on.

title: World Athletics C'ships 2025: India’s full squad and complete schedule in Tokyo
content: India is sending a 19-member squad, spearheaded by javelin star Neeraj Chopra, to the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo from September 13-21. Chopra aims to defend his title, and history will be made with four Indian men competing in the javelin event. Sprinter Animesh Kujur is also set to become the first Indian to participate in the men’s 200m.

title: 'Vote-chori slogan spreading like fire': Rahul vows 'explosive' proof; slams NDA
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has promised to reveal "dynamic and explosive" evidence of vote theft, alleging the NDA government was formed through stolen votes. He claims to have proof of manipulation, particularly highlighting the "Gujarat model" as a scheme for electoral fraud involving PM Modi, Amit Shah, and the Election Commission.

title: $4 bn P-8I defence deal: US team may come to India; talks amid fresh trade ties push
content: Amidst ongoing India-US trade discussions, a US delegation comprising defence officials and Boeing representatives is expected to visit India next week. They will discuss a $4 billion deal for six P-8I naval patrol aircraft, a deal that had previously stalled.

title: Scientists detect ‘geological heartbeat’ that can split Africa and create a new ocean
content: Beneath eastern Africa, scientists have discovered a dramatic geological process driven by rhythmic pulses of molten rock rising from the Earth's mantle. This "geological heartbeat" weakens the crust, causing earthquakes and volcanic activity. Over millions of years, this process is expected to split Africa into two parts, creating a new ocean basin and reshaping the continent.

title: 'Israel did what US did': Netanyahu defends Qatar strike with 9/11 analogy – watch
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu defended the military strike on Hamas leaders in Doha, Qatar, likening it to America's response to 9/11. He asserted that nations shouldn't harbor terrorists and Israel will act against those who do.

title: Aishwarya Rai gets relief: Delhi HC bars misuse of name, photos
content: The Delhi High Court has come down heavily on the unauthorized use of Bollywood actor Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's name, image, and persona, holding that such exploitation without consent not only causes commercial detriment but also impacts her dignity and reputation.

title: Delhi-Kathmandu SpiceJet flight delayed: Passengers exit sweltering cabin
content: SpiceJet passengers on a Delhi-Kathmandu flight faced discomfort after a technical snag caused air conditioning failure, leading to delays and eventual disembarkation. This incident follows a similar Air India ordeal where over 200 Singapore-bound passengers were stranded in a malfunctioning Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner for two hours.

title: Solar eclipse 2025: When is Surya Grahan in September and will it be visible in India?
content: September 2025 features a rare celestial double feature: a dramatic lunar eclipse on the 7th and a partial solar eclipse on the 21st. The solar eclipse, dubbed the "equinox eclipse," will be visible at sunrise in the Southern Hemisphere, particularly in New Zealand, eastern Australia, and parts of the South Pacific.

title: Asia Cup | More than just cricket! Gill hugged UAE player after hitting winning runs
content: In a heartwarming reunion at the Asia Cup 2025, Shubman Gill, India's rising cricket star, shared a special moment with UAE's Simranjeet Singh. Years ago, Simranjeet had bowled to a young Gill in Mohali. After Gill sealed India's victory with a boundary off Simranjeet's bowling, he embraced his former practice partner.

title: Tyreek Hill under NFL probe: Conduct policy review begins as new accusations surface
content: The National Football League is reviewing domestic violence allegations against Tyreek Hill. These allegations came from Hill's estranged wife. The league's decision depends on her cooperation. Miami Dolphins coach Mike McDaniel acknowledged the matter. Hill's past includes a domestic assault case. His attorney denies the new allegations. This case could impact NFL trade rumors.

title: 'Match must go on': SC refuses urgent hearing of PIL; India vs Pak to continue
content: The Supreme Court refused to urgently list a PIL seeking to cancel the India vs. Pakistan cricket match scheduled for the Asia Cup in Dubai. The petition, filed by law students, cited recent political tensions and terror attacks, arguing the match would compromise national dignity.

title: CRPF flags Rahul Gandhi’s foreign trips, cites serious security concerns
content: The CRPF has expressed worries about repeated security protocol breaches by Rahul Gandhi during his international travels, potentially increasing his risk exposure. Despite having Z+ security cover, Gandhi has reportedly skipped necessary safety measures on multiple occasions. The CRPF has urged adherence to security guidelines, emphasizing that violations weaken VVIP protection.

title: Cash, beaker set, motherboard seized: ISIS-inspired module busted; suspects were planning 'IED attacks'
content: Delhi Police have reportedly dismantled an 'IS-inspired' module, arresting suspects across Delhi, Ranchi, and Mumbai. The suspects were allegedly planning IED attacks to establish an Islamic Caliphate. Authorities seized bomb-making materials, including chemicals and electronic components. Investigations suggest an ISI operative posed as an IS recruiter, guiding the suspects through encrypted apps.

title: Parents shield kids, students scatter — Video shows chaos as Charlie Kirk shot on stage
content: During a "Prove Me Wrong" event at Utah University, right-wing activist Charlie Kirk was shot, causing widespread panic. The incident occurred while Kirk addressed a question about transgender mass shooting suspects, turning a campus debate into a scene of terror. Witnesses described the chaos as attendees scrambled for safety, highlighting concerns about security at the event.

title: Why an India vs Pakistan final has never happened in Asia Cup
content: The highly anticipated India-Pakistan cricket clash at the Asia Cup 2025 in Dubai on September 14 is generating immense excitement. Historically, India has dominated high-stakes encounters, particularly in ICC tournaments and Asia Cups. Despite never meeting in an Asia Cup final, India holds a superior head-to-head record, winning 10 of 18 matches against Pakistan.

title: Woman tied up, stabbed to death by 2 domestic helps in Hyderabad flat
content: In Kukatpally, Hyderabad, a shocking incident occurred where a 50-year-old woman was murdered in her apartment by two domestic helpers. The perpetrators, after tying up and stabbing Renu Agarwal, stole gold jewelry and cash. They fled the scene on a two-wheeler, prompting a police manhunt to apprehend them, with suspicion pointing towards Ranchi as a possible escape destination.

title: Raipur airport navigation system fails, flights hit; hundreds of passengers stranded
content: Flight operations at Raipur's Swami Vivekananda Airport faced disruptions on Thursday morning due to a navigation system malfunction, leading to flight cancellations and passenger inconvenience. Airport Director KK Lahre confirmed the technical glitch, with operational work underway to resolve the issue. A passenger, Shantanu Chakraborthy, expressed frustration over his cancelled flight to Kolkata, highlighting the widespread disruption.

title: 'Progress being made': Govt says India-US trade deal likely by Nov; Trump-Modi signal thaw
content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal announced that the initial phase of the trade agreement between India and the United States is expected to be finalized by November 2025. Discussions are progressing positively, with both sides expressing satisfaction, he said.

title: Sunjay Kapur’s sister accuses Priya Kapur of taking everything
content: Karisma Kapoor's children are seeking their share of their late father Sunjay Kapur's estate in the Delhi High Court, escalating a family dispute. Sunjay's sister accuses his widow of seizing everything, leaving their mother without resources. The court has ordered a full asset disclosure, with the next hearing scheduled for October 9 to potentially resolve the inheritance dispute.

title: Asia Cup: Suryakumar better captain than Rohit, Kohli, Dhoni - numbers prove it
content: India dominated UAE in their Asia Cup opener, securing a nine-wicket victory after Kuldeep Yadav's exceptional spin bowling dismantled the hosts for a mere 57 runs. India chased down the target swiftly in just 4.3 overs. Kuldeep Yadav's impressive figures of 4 for 7 led the bowling attack, supported by Shivam Dube's career-best 3/4.

title: Beast mauls, MP woman strikes back: 65-year-old strangles Jackal with sari
content: Surajia Bai Jatav, a 65-year-old woman from Madhya Pradesh, bravely fought off a jackal that attacked her in her field. The fierce encounter lasted for thirty minutes, during which she strangled the animal to death with her sari.

title: PF withdrawals by ATM, seamless transactions: EPFO may rollout benefits before Diwali
content: The EPFO is set to deliberate on the EPFO 3.0 initiative, potentially enabling partial PF withdrawals via ATMs or using them via UPI. Discussions will also include a proposal to increase the minimum monthly pension to between Rs 1,500 and Rs 2,500.

title: Trade deal: India’s chief negotiator may travel to US next week; Modi-Trump call soon
content: Amidst easing tensions, India and the US are set to resume trade talks, signaled by positive exchanges between Prime Minister Modi and President Trump. Chief trade negotiator Rajesh Agarwal will travel to Washington for discussions, though uncertainty remains regarding potential US tariff concessions.

title: Sanjay Kapur estate war: 'Real fight between Priya and Karisma'
content: The legal battle over Sunjay Kapur's estate intensifies as his mother, Rani Kapur, voices concerns about the will's authenticity and undisclosed asset sales. Her lawyer clarified the dispute primarily involves Karisma Kapoor and Priya Sachdeva. The Delhi High Court is reviewing the case after Karisma's children challenged the will, alleging forgery.

title: Solar Eclipse September 2025: Who will see it, and will the UAE miss out?
content: A partial solar eclipse will occur on September 21, 2025, marking the final solar eclipse of the year. The event will be visible only in parts of the Southern Hemisphere, including New Zealand, eastern Australia, and Antarctica. It will not be visible in the UAE, Asia, or the Americas. The eclipse coincides closely with the September equinox.

title: Viral Video: Woman dancing with shirtless Salman not Bigg Boss 19 contestant Kunickaa
content: Salman Khan, hosting Bigg Boss 19, faces controversy over alleged favoritism towards contestant Kunickaa Sadanand. An old video resurfaced, falsely identified Kunickaa dancing with Salman, fueling bias claims. The woman is actually choreographer Pony Verma, Prakash Raj's wife, unrelated to Kunickaa's current Bigg Boss stint. Other contestants include Gaurav Khanna, Amaal Mallik and Ashnoor Kaur.

title: 'Circumstances similar': Udit Raj likens Nepal turmoil to India; BJP hits back
content: Congress leader Udit Raj drew parallels between Nepal's recent political turmoil and potential scenarios in India, referencing Sri Lanka and Bangladesh. He asserted that while similar conditions exist, India's robust Constitution and deeply rooted democracy, established by the Congress party, prevent such overthrows. This statement follows violent Gen Z-led protests in Nepal that led to significant political upheaval.

title: A gunshot, then screams: How assassination of Trump loyalist Charlie Kirk unfolded
content: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk was fatally shot while speaking at Utah Valley University, prompting a campus lockdown. Donald Trump mourned Kirk, calling him a "martyr" for conservative values. The incident occurred during a Q&A session, and witnesses described chaos as Kirk was shot in the neck. While initial reports suggested an arrest, the suspect remains at large, according to officials.

title: Watch: Nepal ministers, kin hold on to chopper rope to escape
content: Nepal is facing a severe political crisis as violent protests erupted in Kathmandu following a social media ban, leading to Prime Minister Oli's resignation. Ministers and their families were evacuated by army helicopters amidst public anger, with videos showing dramatic escapes.

title: Enhanced Games: Olympics medallist joins multi-sport event where drugs are legal
content: British Olympic medalist Ben Proud is set to participate in the Enhanced Games, a controversial event allowing performance-enhancing drugs, scheduled for May 2026 in Las Vegas. Proud's decision means he will be banned from international competitions. The Enhanced Games will feature swimming, sprinting, and weightlifting, with substantial cash prizes for winners and record-breakers.

title: WBC reveals championship ring for Canelo vs. Crawford fight
content: the undisputed super middleweight title fight between canelo alvarez and challenger Terence Crawford has a key piece of jewelry at stake . the ring, designed by WBC strategic partner Rasheen Farlow, is valued at over $100,000 . a collection of green stones makes up the trademark green belt in the center .

title: As difficulties mount at Man City, could this season be Guardiola's last?
content: pep Guardiola is facing a challenge at every stop of his managerial career . he has already answered it once with 18 trophies in nine years in man city . but he's facing the prospect of having to answer it all over again .

title: What makes a baseball player exciting? We asked two rising MLB stars
content: a baseball player bracket skews young, with the average age (26.4) more than two years younger than the MLB average (28.6) . the bracket embodies several common qualities among our 32 entrants . "i just like seeing guys who can do a lot of different things on the field," says a representative .

title: 'Nacua must mix his oatmeal with cement': Rams can't overstate WR's importance
content: los Angeles Rams wide receiver Davante Adams saw the collision in the middle of the field . he was taken to the locker room after a concussion and receiving stitches . the third-year receiver finished with 10 catches for 130 yards, by far the leading receiver .

title: Pulisic rates 9/10 as win vs. Japan gets USMNT back on track
content: alejandro Zendejas and Folarin Balogun both score as the united states defeats Japan 2-0 . the men's national team quickly bounced back with a more proactive attack through an experimental 3-4-3 formation . in a first half, the home side created danger through high-pressing fullbacks Max Arfsten and Alex Freeman .
